blog.name: jillypups
blog.title: And Jil Came Tumbling After
blog.description: I'm a bookish type. Clumsy, affable, tall.

summary:
Bowled Over by Jillypups - Chapter 13
https://archiveofourown.org/works/15180440/chapters/36934926
It’s a sweet nameless dream...
body:
Bowled Over by Jillypups - Chapter 13

https://archiveofourown.org/works/15180440/chapters/36934926

It’s a sweet nameless dream that wakes Sansa and makes her open her eyes, but she’s not sorry for the disruption to her sleep. Dappled sunlight dances across her bedroom walls in the shape of shadowed leafy boughs, all blousy sway with the faintest tinkling of wind chimes from her neighbor’s backyard. The light is wan, either due to an early hour or a scatter of lingering clouds. Likely both. It’s dreamy and sweet, not as obtrusive as a fast, summer afternoon sun, and there’s a coolness to the air that’s always present after a good long rain.

Show Chapter | Archive of Our Own

tags: a song of ice and fire
title: Westeros 2.0
body:
Lately, I’ve been following a lot of YouTube channels and reading theories regarding the predictions and the eventual end-game for S8. And a lot of those theories are very interesting. But today I want to talk about what happens after the war is over. 

I’ve been thinking about some things that can occur after all the fighting is done and I would like your ideas too. Here’s some of mine,

1. The ‘King’ of the Seven Kingdoms?

Once the fighting is over, Westeros will need a leader to take it back to its old glory. But who will be that leader? 

If you read my last blog post, you would know that I mentioned about the possibilities of Cersei dying and the speculations regarding Dany’s death and how she may fulfil the Nissa Nissa prophesy. I believe Cersei will die. And I believe that Dany will die, maybe in childbirth or she will be killed by Jon so that he could turn his sword into Lightbringer (if he is Azor Ahai), or maybe she’ll fall fighting the Night King and become a wight! Maybe Jon would be forced to kill her before killing the Night King. That would surely be bittersweet. Not just because Jon would have to kill her but because she would surely fight back and try to kill him at the same time. 

But in the end, Jon will become King just like Robert Baratheon. Neither of them started their respective fights for the Throne. They started it for things that were way more important to them- Jon for survival and Robert for revenge. But like Robert before him, Jon would find himself in a position where he is the most viable choice. And I’m pretty sure Jon would take over the helm because if there is one thing he doesn’t run away from, it’s leading. He became the Commander of the Night’s Watch and then he became King in the North. He won’t ask for it, but if the people of Westeros choose him, he won’t disappoint them. 

Or you know, he could just take the title himself. He is the heir anyway. But we know that won’t happen. 

2. What about the Capital?  [SPOILERS]

Right now there is a lot of buzz surrounding the fighting scenes in S8. There was a picture which showed Winterfell in a horrendous condition, burning, and bodies lying one over the other like haystacks. There is a strong possibility that Winterfell would fall into the hands of the Night King and that the final battle for the dawn would continue in King’s Landing, the current home of the Queen and the capital of Westeros. 

But when the fighting is over, all that is left of King’s Landing may just be ashes. Think about it, three dragons in the sky, hundreds of thousands of soldiers/wights and hundreds of ships bombarding the city. The fighting will be brutal and King’s Landing may see its end. There are also speculations about the destruction of the Iron throne, either during the fighting or after it, just to finish off a major reason behind thousands of deaths over centuries of its existence. 

So what will happen when Jon becomes King?

I want to believe that given both King’s Landing and Winterfell would need a major restoration after the war, Jon would choose Winterfell as his home and a place from where he’ll do all the ruling. 

In the show, Jon has only been the King’s Landing once in S7 while he has lived his entire life in the North and a major part of it back at Winterfell. We also know just how much it would mean to the Northerners to see a ‘Northern’ King of the Seven Kingdoms (or six or five, whatever number is left) ruling from Winterfell. The North wanted independence when Robb was chosen King and they probably wanted it now as well before Jon bent the knee and gave up his title. It won’t exactly be like independence but it would definitely help if someone from the North rules from the North.

And most of the royal families of the South would probably not see the end of the war to raise any major objections for the change of the capital. The Lannisters would be dead, Tyrion may survive and maybe Cersei’s child too if she really is pregnant. But then again, the North is just as much away from King’s Landing as King’s Landing is from the North. So if the King wills it, I don’t even see a reason for objections.

The North is the biggest kingdom amongst the seven and the closest to the things that lie beyond the wall. But after the Night King is defeated, the threat from beyond the wall will basically be none. The wildlings are now fighting and living around the rest of the people and I’m sure they will stay south of the wall after the war as well. But if Jon becomes King, he’ll be smart enough to know that it’s best to restore the wall back to its old glory and keep the same protocol as before. Who knows, maybe the Night King has a backup plan? Maybe the dead will rise again someday. Jon will be clever enough to not underestimate the far North and the surprises it can present.    

But to conclude this particular topic, I’ll say that the show started at Winterfell and it may end at Winterfell too. I don’t see a reason for it to not be so.

3. Aegon Targaryen or Jon Snow?

“You are a Greyjoy. And you are a Stark,” Jon told Theon. 

Jon has lived as a bastard his entire life. But at times, he wanted to be a Stark, like his father and his brothers. But now we know who he really is and I’m curious if he takes up his real name once the war is over. Will he make people call him Aegon? 

I’m going to make a prediction here and say that Jon will continue being ‘Jon’ even if he becomes King because the Starks are the only family he has ever known and Ned Stark is the only man he has ever considered his father. 

One fragment of history may change his lineage but it won’t change his heart. And Jon Snow will always be a Stark in his heart.  

There are speculations regarding Arya and how she may leave Westeros once the war is won, and before leaving I can see her telling Jon something along the lines of, “A man can choose whoever he wants to be. A man can take up whatever name he likes. A man can be anyone, or a man can be no one. But  whatever you do, you’ll always be a Stark to me.”  

If Dany gives Jon a baby or two before dying, what he can do to make sure the Targaryen name survives is to give the babies the Targaryen name. But I think Jon will always stay a Stark- to him and to the people around him.

The North wanted independence when Robb was chosen King and they probably wanted it now as well before Jon bent the knee and gave up his title. It won’t exactly be like independence but it would definitely help if someone from the North rules from the North.

And most of the royal families of the South would probably not see the end of the war to raise any major objections for the change of the capital. The Lannisters would be dead, Tyrion may survive and maybe Cersei’s child too if she really is pregnant. But then again, the North is just as much away from King’s Landing as King’s Landing is from the North. So if the King wills it, I don’t even see a reason for objections.

The North is the biggest kingdom amongst the seven and the closest to the things that lie beyond the wall. But after the Night King is defeated, the threat from beyond the wall will basically be none. The wildlings are now fighting and living around the rest of the people and I’m sure they will stay south of the wall after the war as well. But if Jon becomes King, he’ll be smart enough to know that it’s best to restore the wall back to its old glory and keep the same protocol as before. Who knows, maybe the Night King has a backup plan? Maybe the dead will rise again someday. Jon will be clever enough to not underestimate the far North and the surprises it can present.    

But to conclude this particular topic, I’ll say that the show started at Winterfell and it may end at Winterfell too. I don’t see a reason for it to not be so.

3. Aegon Targaryen or Jon Snow?

“You are a Greyjoy. And you are a Stark,” Jon told Theon. 

Jon has lived as a bastard his entire life. But at times, he wanted to be a Stark, like his father and his brothers. But now we know who he really is and I’m curious if he takes up his real name once the war is over. Will he make people call him Aegon? 

I’m going to make a prediction here and say that Jon will continue being ‘Jon’ even if he becomes King because the Starks are the only family he has ever known and Ned Stark is the only man he has ever considered his father. 

One fragment of history may change his lineage but it won’t change his heart. And Jon Snow will always be a Stark in his heart.  

There are speculations regarding Arya and how she may leave Westeros once the war is won, and before leaving I can see her telling Jon something along the lines of, “A man can choose whoever he wants to be. A man can take up whatever name he likes. A man can be anyone, or a man can be no one. But  whatever you do, you’ll always be a Stark to me.”  

If Dany gives Jon a baby or two before dying, what he can do to make sure the Targaryen name survives is to give the babies the Targaryen name. But I think Jon will always stay a Stark- to him and to the people around him.

tags: lol is that the tag i started for him IT’S BEEN SO LONG
summary: In case anyone is interested lol, my Producer Dad TM (who is still not convinced of Jonsa but isn’t writing it off) has the...
body:
In case anyone is interested lol, my Producer Dad TM (who is still not convinced of Jonsa but isn’t writing it off) has the following to say about the teaser:

- D is shown as the villain/warmaker

- Jon is shown as a hero/peacemaker

- Jaime is the one who has observed D’s actions and isn’t on her side, so he will likely provide a source of tension between D and the Starks (since they are not-as-convinced allies)

- in the new footage, Sansa is probably either looking at D or looking at nothing/being pensive, but the important thing for the teaser is that we’re supposed to THINK that she’s looking at D or thinking about her—teasing conflict

- our opinions about which side of the conflict Jon will be on will inform our predictions of the storyline of S8—this is meant to get people talking/speculating. D is a fan favorite and Sansa is not (and is teased for being like LF and Cersei), so people are more likely to see D as good and Sansa as bad in this conflict, aka believing that Jon (also good) will side with D.

- my dad’s opinion on this conflict: D is shown as villain, so it is highly unlikely Jon will be on her side—however, he could advocate for her at the beginning to build tension before he takes the Starks’/Sansa’s side in the end. He thinks this could cause major tension between Jon and Ar*a more than Jon and Sansa because their first reunion may be plagued by this conflict, and because Sansa plays the game but Ar*a speaks up against things she disagrees with

So basically his takeaway was that the teaser’s narrative is that of D vs Starks, specifically D vs Sansa in the new footage. And most people will conclude that Sansa is evil/plotting from that, but he thinks it’s a way to tease dark!D instead.

Since I like to get his opinions without sharing Jonsa theories with him (to see how someone in the GA but with professional TV experience would think), I didn’t really push the Jonsa, but everything he said was really interesting to me!

tags: people just say the most bullshit of things
like you must not follow the plot closely enough if you're going to pull out such a dry take.
summary: How did Sansa not have an impact on the overall plot in the first few seasons? Sansa was an important political piece through...
body: How did Sansa not have an impact on the overall plot in the first few seasons? Sansa was an important political piece through out the entire show. She was a political hostage of the Lannisters and she impacted lot of the characters (and their decisions/storylines) such as Catelyn, and by extension Jaime/Brienne. Their storyline only went the way it did because she was in King’s Landing. A big part why the Tyrell even killed Joffrey was partially because of his history with abusing women (a.k.a Sansa). Also, while she didn’t have that much power in King’s Landing, she was still of importance. She was the one who started leading The Hound into changing, it was through her that we were introduced to the Tyrells, her position as key to the north had an utmost impact to what happened in King’s Landing in season 3. Not only through her marriage with Tyrion, but her situation led to other things such as the Cersei/Loras match, and Shae distancing herself from Tyrion. That’s not forgetting the fact what she caused after she left King’s Landing. Her being in the Vale caused Lysa pretty much to go batshit insane which led her trying to kill Sansa which resulted in her death which changed the political situation in the vale dramatically, Sansa managing to manipulate the lords and ladies of the vale and keeping Littlefinger alive definitely had some impact on the story. Sansa was the one who instigated the change in Theon’s character which led him to his Season 6-7 storyline. To say that she was useless just because she didn’t kill no one in the earlier seasons is ridiculous when her existence alone had such an impact on the story/character. Without Sansa, the happenings in King’s Landing are dramatically different, the situation with Littlefinger and the Vale change radically, and the North becomes a completely different beast.

blog.name: thegeekembassy
blog.title: The Geek Embassy
blog.description:
The ambassadors of Geek Embassy endeavor to share all types of geeky passions with our community. As a group, we write individually but we come together to share our collective experiences with different media. For TGE Watches, we talk about movies and TV shows. TGE Plays, we play games together. For TGE Reads, we select a book, read it, and then discuss it together. We are hoping through our collective knowledge and know-how to share these geeky interests with our readers, viewers, and listeners. 

Listen to our podcast at https://www.thegeekembassy.com/category/podcast

tags: Game of Thrones Reunions We Can&039;t Wait For
summary: Game of Thrones Reunions We Can't Wait for: Sansa and The Hound
title: Game of Thrones Reunions We Can't Wait for: Sansa and The Hound
body:
Game of Thrones Reunions We Can’t Wait for: Sansa and The Hound

It’s not certain whether some characters will meet again in the final season of Game of Thrones. For example, we don’t know whether Sandor Clegane, better known as The Hound, is headed to Winterfell with most of the other characters. But if he is, his meeting with Sansa Stark should be an interesting one.

Little Bird

All of The Hound’s interactions with Sansa take place during the first two…

View On WordPress

tags: sansa’s doing nothing wrong leave her alone
summary: I don’t understand why everyone seems to hate Sansa Stark because even though she was childish at first all she’s done since,...
body: I don’t understand why everyone seems to hate Sansa Stark because even though she was childish at first all she’s done since, like, season two is adapt and try to survive after being a prisoner, then a fugitive, then a prisoner again. Since getting back to winterfell she’s done nothing but make sure her people are safe and I don’t see why people say she’s trying to steal Jon’s throne she just wants to survive the winter and the war. She has suffered to get where she is now and she better not die in season eight
